website_summaries.verdict: The overall performance of this router was good, but it probably won't hold up to lots of devices in a large home. It does have bonus features, including link aggregation and security powered by Trend Micro, so you will get a lot of bang for your buck.
pros: The router performs very well on 5GHz and has lots of features and customization options
It's small, lightweight and has wall mounting brackets
cons: The 2.4GHz band had spotty coverage that was inconsistent at times

customer_reviews.title: Great Coverage in Old House with Plaster Walls, 10+ Active Clients. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable, consistent. In use for 4 months, not a single reboot. Very easy setup via Android app and laptop. My environment: Old house (1924) with old plaster wall, normally challenging for WiFi. Dual band 2.4/5.0 helps a lot. Family of 5, adults and college students, typically 10-15 WiFi devices active at any given time - 5+ mobile phones, Amazon Echo, wireless printer, Sony PS4, 1 smart TV, 2 smart watches, etc. Positioned in center of house. Hard wired to smart TV for video streaming. No WiFi repeaters or bridges needed. Good coverage throughout house. Very happy with AC2300, Definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MikeFairfieldCT

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because I had pretty much had enough of my current router. The signal was spotty at best, was often disappearing, and I couldn't even get a decent signal on the second floor of my 1700 square foot house. Also, for months I've been blaming my internet provider for only giving me 20 Mbps of the 40 Mbps I've been paying for. Turns out, I've been yelling at the wrong people. This router booms throughout my house and I get all 40 of my speed. Getting to control it with the Tether app is nice as well. This is a solid investment for your home Wifi set up.
customer_reviews.author: Deeds777

customer_reviews.title: 5G issues after one year
customer_reviews.text: The 5G network starting having intermittent issues until finally almost year to the day I ordered it it kept dropping my 5G devices about every 10 minutes. I switched them to 2.4G and the are ok. Did not want to bother with trying to get warranty support, not worth my time. I have had older routers last years, my old router was working for a few years but wanted to get something newer with a bit more range for 4k streaming. When it was working it was fine, but should last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Signal strength just fine... when it works
customer_reviews.text: I've had my router for about 3 months now and did not have many problems. However, this past week when my electricity went out momentarily, I was unable to bring the router back up to full functionality; the wifi signal/SSID is nonexistent and the only way I can connect to the internet is through ethernet cables connected to the modem or router (making the router useless). Naturally, this happens 11 days after the warranty expires and tp-link technical support has been less than helpful. Save yourself the headache and do some research on longer-lasting routers instead.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for the money
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around and bought this router based on the recommendation of some website or other, I'm glad I did. It's reasonably priced and the wireless works very well. I replaced an older ASUS RT-N56U with this one. I use WiFi Analyzer to monitor the signal coverage in my house and this one definitely provides a stronger signal over a wider range than the old one, on both 2.4 and 5GHz bands. It might not have as many bells and whistles as some higher-priced models, and while I stream movies and TV, I don't do on-line gaming, so I can't comment on it's performance as far as that goes, but it has everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drops connection - this is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This was a nightmare to connect. I had to disconnect every single device in my home in order to get it to connect to anything at all - all my Amazon products, my thermostat, my sprinkler system, all my plugs, my ringdoorbell etc. Once I spent several hours setting all my smarthome devices back up, it now disconnects constantly - probably 10-20 times per day that I have to reconnect things. This is a very poorly made device. It won't even stay connected to its own brand of smart plug!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for 7 months then needed an RMA - Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router in Nov 2017 and everything was fantastic until May 2018. Between those dates the router worked flawless. In May 2018 the router began experiencing intermittent failures with wifi connectivity requiring hard resets to fix, and then repeated failures on LAN ports as well. I RMA'd the router and customer service was great. Still waiting on the replacement but reverted back to my old WRT54G. 10 years old and still works, never failed. The TP link is good, but based on this failure and duration of the RMA process, I won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric I.

customer_reviews.title: Great at the beginning
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal is very good when the router is working. Now after 4 months of no interruptions, I am now experiencing intermittent signal dropouts (5x/wk) and the only way to rectify is to shut off/on. I've been troubleshooting the situation for a couple weeks, but came to a conclusion it's the router. In the meantime, ive deployed my old router, just trotting at slower speeds but at least the connection is solid. Other than that, the the unit was easy to install and configure.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: This is the best route I have used for a home setting
customer_reviews.text: This is the best route I have used for a home setting. It has a lot of great features. It works just how you would expected. Ive had this route for about a month and I have not needed to restart it due to network issues. It has worked with no hiccups. I did have some issues getting it to work with Cox, the solution was that you need to run the startup config from the router homepage and also make sure you choose that Cox has a static MAC address for connecting to the internet. That solved my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great bandwidth
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to setup - it even automatically set the local IP to avoid conflict with the primary modem/router. the signal is so strong I was able to eliminate the WiFi extenders I was previously using. I am streaming 4 TV's 4 Alexas, 9 Smart switches and even a few computers all with perfect speed and clear signal. I wish I did this a while ago!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Router worked great for 6 months. I am giving it one star because the manufacturer would not honor the 2 year warranty. Sold by Amazing Warehouse Deals and they don't recognize them as a seller and would not allow me to exchange even though it is theirs and had 18 months warranty. Before buying check with TP-Link to see if they honor the returns. If it was so by Amazon then no issue.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an upgrade to my router (just got a 4k TV and wanted to make sure my electronic infrastructure was adequate for optimal display). I used some apps to measure the bandwidth before and after, and I did get an 35% performance increase. I also like the interface with the computer and it is easy to change the settings compared to my older router. The 'smart' feature picks the channel with the least traffic and the best chance at speed...nice.
customer_reviews.author: Allessio77

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & and a good start for IDS/IPS services
customer_reviews.text: Bought primarily because city's ISP uses TP-Link products for residential and business accounts. I had earlier installed a TP-Link WAP for a state local office business account and very pleased with ease to install and config. Have had no issues with three Tp-Link router products installed. Of most importance to note is that the AC2300 router has a "HomeCare" feature which provides anti-virus malware detection and prevention services at the router level. However, would suggest that TP-Link do daily threat database updates and/or provide feature for scheduled router reboot which would then update that database.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it died.
customer_reviews.text: This router is blisteringly fast, but died within a few hours. Not sure what happened, but it kept trying to reboot and could not get through the boot cycle. Amazon was quick to ship a new unit and I look forward to getting this model back up and running. I am hopeful that the next unit is more reliable and will revise my review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: SRT

customer_reviews.title: If you have a 4K Smart TV, invest in this router--you will need it
customer_reviews.text: Despite what my internet and cable provider told me about my old router (cerca 2013) being "good enough" for my new 4k smart tv, I ended up having to invest in this router. You only need one for a two-story home application like ours. I can even get the signal in our attic if I need it. NO boosters are needed so don't let anyone tell you to buy additional equipment. This router is fast! and does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Sebek

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Netgear NightHawk
customer_reviews.text: My nighthawk R7000 died. Got this to replace it. Half the price, better interface. More control over users. Faster speeds, and not ugly as an F-17. I've had it going 24/7 for 60 days. No hiccups. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DevourerofWorlds

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: One of the best routers I've ever had. I accidentally dropped my previous router and ruined it's antenna so I had to get a new one. I went with this and wish I had gotten it years ago. My internet speed doubled and I don't know why. Same modem same internet package. Something on my old router was limiting my data stream and I didn't even know. It would be 5 stars if the software was better. It's great for the normal end user I just wish it had some of the more advanced router features that are starting to become common. For example being able to connect this router to an external VPN.
customer_reviews.author: Jon K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. It's easy to use, according to the FBI it has not been compromised by Russian malware, it is easy to update the firmware (via the app), allows you to set up multi-access points which is great for guests, it greatly improved our WiFi speeds and we finally have WiFi in parts of the house that lacked coverage before. My favourite feature is it's anti-DDoS properties and the visibility it gives into which users are connected to your network as well as all the attacks it help prevent automatically. 6 months and still running like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Kimball

customer_reviews.title: TP Link ac2300
customer_reviews.text: Router quit broadcating wireless after 3 months.5 ghz quit working Contacted TP LInk supposedly under warranty, but may have to wait up to a week or more for replacement. Mean time no wireless firestick smart tv roku etc. Will buy local next time. Still waiting on phone call back contacted TP Link on 8-26-2018 Customer service hard to understand person talking. 9- 5- 2018 Waiitng on my replacement for my TP link AC2300 this is my third unit Since writing my review they have sent another router and it has been working really well for about six months now
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage, fast speed
customer_reviews.text: Whole house coverage (2200sqft) with it on the first floor and 50+mbs connection from the farthest points upstairs and in the basement. Why did it take me so long to upgrade?! Works well with my comcast internet connection and owned (not rented) tp-link modem. I didn't use the "cloud" setup. Why would i want access to my router on the internet?? the local setup was easy and had simple port forwarding that I needed. Can handle several smart light switches, thermostat, multiple phones and tablets, rokus and gaming systems and wired pc's all at once (the belkin it replaced couldn't without being reset at least twice a week). Would recommend for most single family homes.
customer_reviews.author: Xanthene

customer_reviews.title: Wireless speeds especially on 5 GHz are good. Web GUI Management is OK
customer_reviews.text: Wireless speeds especially on 5 GHz are good. Web GUI Management is OK. Cons: 1) To use Tether App you have to restrict password length to 15 characters; 2) no support for external syslog server; 3) no HTTPS web management connection. So security needs to be imporved ASAP. If Tether password restriction is fixed and HTTPS implemented then 4 stars. 6/25/2019: Firmware is buggy and last update (USA) was well over a year ago. Tech support is erratic. On one unit (a warranty replacemnt) 5 GHz is disabled permanently. Time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is a really great router that has been serving me well for over 3 months, but I was getting faster throughput speeds with my old Archer C9 that is several years old. I have ATT fiber and with the 300MB plan on the archer C9, I was getting faster speeds than with this model on ATT internet 1000 (Gigabit speeds). I would go back to the C9, but the latest firmware release botched the device pretty bad and it was one of those releases where you cannot downgrade after installation. Again, this is a really good device, I was just expecting much better from it with the advertised increase in Wireless AC throughput.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Update firmware right away
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste time on setting up custom network names and passwords when you first turn it on, there's a firmware update that resets these settings back to factory default. Speed tests are amazing. I was coming from an old N150 wifi router without much range and even have an extender I bought because of that lack of range. The extender could only operate at 48mbps. With the new wifi router, it's picking up 144mbps. I'll be retiring this soon though as the signal is strong enough to reach the back rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Big Richard

customer_reviews.title: What a difference from my very old WIFI and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my Five Star review is due to starting out with the feeling of impending interface doom. The instructions were clear, buttons labeled nice and the software was easy to understand. I had a bit of consternation on how to get into the administrator window but it was easy. Setting up multiple accounts: home, guest, different speed delivery was easy and fun too..well, maybe not fun. Size is OK. Certainly could be bigger and there are smaller but they did not have the specs or as good of reviews.
customer_reviews.author: TheBob

customer_reviews.title: Fast, low power and stable router.
customer_reviews.text: Very good router, fast shipping to South Korea, setup very easy and quick, already running more than 2 weeks and no problem and running smooth. I have tried to test what is the lowest voltage this TP Link AC2300 can go, tried to use USB to 5.5mm adapter cable, at 5V/1.5A can boot up but operation is not stable (drop reboot every few minutes), my current setup is using smaller 12V/1.5A adapter and running smooth stable since first day. Without external hdd attached this router only need around 7 Watt for normal operation.
customer_reviews.author: HMaxF

customer_reviews.title: Solid Fast Performance, Easy to setup App
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and setup straight out of the box. Instructions were fairly straightforward. Upgraded from an old netgear N600 router to this and immediately had great performance improvement. Specially if you do local DLNA or airplay streaming was even able to handle 4k video smoothly. Love the app which allows status and configuration remotely. Another favorite feature is smart connect, which makes the router automatically select 2.4 or 5 g spectrum for your devices so you don’t have to keep switching between them. Only problem had was connecting up a samsung wps air printer which it would not recognize, but could be a printer issue also.
customer_reviews.author: munna bhai

customer_reviews.title: Faster than Netgear
customer_reviews.text: I have used Netgear for many years, and up until this router, probably would have upgraded to a newer model. Install was pretty easy, set the router up through advanced settings on wireless, before switching out other router, so it was plug and play. Throughput is amazing, nearly double what I was getting on the Netgear dual wan SPI firewall. 336 In for one day so far, so will update once I have some time involved using it,, but so far excellent, and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jahare

customer_reviews.title: Solid router that works with other router/modem
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any major issues with the router for about 18 months now. I like the tether app where I can access the settings and check the status. Good distance and signal strength through semi-modern walls (drywall). Many devices can be connected without bogging it down and I have it installed where there are four wireless devices connected and two LAN devices connected. Occasionally, I have to do a reboot to get it to play well again with the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: More reliable than the wifi supplied by AT&T
customer_reviews.text: Like many households, I now have 15-20 devices connect to wifi. I have a small house, but the wifi supplied with AT&T Fiber had limited range. Everyone on my business conference calls knew that I was the one with bad internet because it kept dropping out. I discovered that the gateway to internet connection was fine--100 Mbs up and down--but the wifi signal was poor in my home office, not more than 25 feet from the access point. The TP-Link router solved all that. I haven't had a drop since.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Don

customer_reviews.title: Router dies after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this router, I was amazed. It doubled my internet speeds over my older router and it worked great without cutting in and out. For 6 months, it was fantastic, best router ever. All of a sudden, 8 months in, it starts dying on me. I absolutely loved this router, but it doesn't last. I wished I paid a little more for something that would not have died on me.
customer_reviews.author: LabJoe

customer_reviews.title: Strongest Signal, Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several routers from other companies such as Linksys, Netgear, Asus, etc, over the years. This one has by far the strongest signal in my house. It had an issue within the warranty period. TP-link's 24 hour technical support identified the problem and sent a replacement very quickly. I was pleasantly to see the replacement was a brand one in retail package instead of a refurbished as most companies would do. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage though USB 3.0 is a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Setup with this TP-Link via web-browser or iOS app was very simple; less than 10 minutes. While the coverage was a great irregardless of floor in a 1500+ sq. ft. split-level home, the one significant flaw I noticed was that the usb 3.0 slot was very much non-functional. With an external hard drive connected, which itself is 3.0 compatible, I was only getting 3 mpbs/ second download, and even less on the upload. Simply put, if you want to use your own external hard drive for "cloud" purposes look elsewhere. Returned due to that reality.
customer_reviews.author: Life Generalist

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: The unit seemed to work great but, I sent it back because I found out it was not necessary to have to run my system now. I guess when I upgraded my internet then the extra router was overkill. Amazon was great though they took it back and gave me a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cecil Marley Jr

customer_reviews.title: The TP-Link AC2300 is a great router!
customer_reviews.text: I had absolutely NO trouble with setup-was as close to plug and play for me as possible (Cox internet service with Arris modem) and it works as well as my Asus AC68U. (Surprisingly, it actually stretches a bit further in the 5ghz band). Which is saying a LOT, as the 68U is a great router. It is solidly built and looks really nice. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Method2Madness

customer_reviews.title: Feature Rich
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an Orbi mesh system with this. The Orbi failed in 18 months but had more than enough range and bandwidth for our 3500 foot house. This unit is a little undersized for our place, but the ease of setup and feature set more than mad up for it.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Insurance Protection and Mfgr Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Last Sept 2018 I bought this AC2300 and it worked just fine up until June 2019. At the time of purchase I took out Square Trade (?) Insurance offered by Amazon and of course the router has a 2 yr warranty. The insurance turned out to be a joke as they wouldn't do anything until the Mfg responded because it was under their warranty. Problem the Mfgr couldn't be found by either me or Amazon. Bottom line, the router worked well until it failed, however, don't expect the 2 yr Mfg warranty to be worth anything. As to the insurance, stay away from it, it's a joke!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Dead 4 Months Short of 3 Years
customer_reviews.text: This is my first and last TP Link purchase. About 9 months ago the faster connection network stopped working. I've been using the slower connection until today when the router stopped working entirely and won't even turn on. It has died 4 months short of being 3 years old. The Arris modem I bought the same day as this router has been working flawless and still remains in my home. No reason an electronic device with zero moving parts should break.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin

customer_reviews.title: Wow..
customer_reviews.text: Boy oh boy. This is one sweet router. Super super SUPER easy to set up. I would set it up with TP-Links app (Tether). That makes it even easier. The computer setup interface can be just as simple or advanced as you want it. The router also comes with built in security which is nice to have. Can't beat this router for the price. TP-Link really know what they are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Ease of set up
customer_reviews.text: Our modem is in a down stairs location. We live upstairs and our previous router struggled to get a signal to us. We were running about a 6.0 Mbps download with it and now running at about 32. BIIIGGGG improvement! I was so impressed with the ease of set up. was able to do it wirelessly and no need for cables. Changed the password on it to the same as our old one and none of my devices "knew" the difference. Just faster and no buffering.
customer_reviews.author: David Quillen

customer_reviews.title: it was excellent but Wifi stopped working
customer_reviews.text: At the very beginning was excellent, extremely amazing with concrete walls but after my kiddo unplug the router from the outlet because want to charge his game the router wifi stopped working, there was no signal, i tried reboot, reset, etc, etc and i couldn't made it work again, after some research i found that some other personas had the same exact problem with no right answer from TP-Link, they say upgrade the firmware, reboot, reconfigure, factory reset but at the very end just the obvios... return the item. Unfortunately i'm living outside from the States and it's not possible to send it back. But well be aware of TP-Link Support...
customer_reviews.author: Darvy Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal coverage, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router for whole house coverage. Strong signals on both main and walk out levels. I have 24 devices connected including a NAS server, 3 amazon devices, multiple iPads/phones, thermostat and Tivo. While very intuitive and easy to set up for the majority of users, the GUI (or maybe the instructions, need some work for advanced configurations including opening ports. UI does need some tweaks ie. listing of attached devices presentation screens need work. However, I would absolutely recommend. Very reliable connections in past 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Good speed, lousy for a smart home
customer_reviews.text: I was perfectly happy with this router until I started installing smart devices. What they don't list anywhere is that there is a 32 connection limit. When you have multiple smart switches, bulbs, door bells, security cameras, etc...those 32 devices get used up fast and then things start dropping and can't reconnect. Direct quote from support "Yes for this router you can connect up to 32 devices " Apparently it is a hardware limit so flashing the firmware won't help. Of course there is no way of knowing this when you buy the router. Now I have to find another solution and I've had this device too long to return it. What a waste of $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Jacklin

customer_reviews.title: Range and speed is very good.
customer_reviews.text: Range is better than the Apple Airport Express I replaced. Also seams to have better bandwidth. We tend to have a lot of visitors during the summer and it handles all the devices very well. I speed test it periodically and it’s also way better than the old router. Download speed is between 10 and 20 Mbps and upload speed is 3-4 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Two Dogs

customer_reviews.title: New TP-link router fan
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it installed for a couple weeks now. No issues - Lan speeds are as advertised and so is 5g WiFi. Range is also good. I’m using this as a router/wifi access point with internet from cable modem. I highly recommend this router - lots of router for the price compared to competitors. Setup was very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Nustad510

customer_reviews.title: Okay at first and then unusable after just 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for 3 months other than need for frequent reboots. After 4 months, speeds dropped to half and service provider showed me that bypassing the router, speeds are fine. Now have to replace it with something else. Should not happen with a modem that costs this much! I have typical WiFi demands, nothing extreme.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure using their interface. Works well with other WiFi extenders. We like the options in the interface too. All in all I would buy this one again. I have purchase one for friends who are looking for a good router and have suggested others to buy this one as well. I am an IT Tech and feel it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good WiFi router.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little setting up, especially if you want to do a custom PW. but after a little bit of reading and research, i was able to take care of this. the signal seems to do a pretty good job, but does get weak through a some walls. so finding the best placement can be a little tricky.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larum

customer_reviews.title: Very good, wifi signal strength is very good not great.
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily, made no adjustments to settings. Did not have expected coverage but not bad. My router has 200 meg plus download speed. The AC 2300 gets that within a select area on 5G. However further away on 5G the download speed drops to 80meg to 125 meg depending (time of day?) Didn't try to adjust settings, decided to live with it. At the price, a bit disappointed but would recommend purchase. Much Better than several other routers I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Zinich

customer_reviews.title: Powerful WiFi Router!
customer_reviews.text: This router was extremely easy to set up, and has been working perfect with many devices using it's WiFi, extremely fast, great distance also, I can walk to my back woods nearly 2 acres back from the WiFi and I still have a connection with my IPhone 6s Plus which is twice the distance of my old WiFi router
customer_reviews.author: Smootherworld

customer_reviews.title: Very nice upgrade from my n600 which gave problems
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far on first impressions, only had it 1week now. The range is very impressive. I get 4/4 wifi bars on my phone outside my home. Very easy to set up and install. I play fifa online with very little lag. There are about 10 wireless devices connected in my home with no buffering. The temperature is a bit warm but nothing of concern so far.
customer_reviews.author: trini003

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a problem with data speed dropping at a distance from our old router, so I had installed a range extender, which was ok, but kept freezing and I just had enough of that. So, I purchased this one and it fixed all the issues. Now in any part of the house we have very fast speed and it never needed to be restarted or anything. Very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Best router I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Used this router for a while before writing this review. I bought a netgear nighthawk router had great reviews but was junk didnt even make it 6 months worse than $20.00 tp link old router. This tp link 2300 router blows all others I have had out of the water. Easy to set up and manage. The WiFi distance is the best I have had from any router. After changing to this router I now get speeds over what I pay for. The best router for this house ease of use great speeds and very nice to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R.

customer_reviews.title: No Issues So Far
customer_reviews.text: Installation was fast and easy. We have a 2600sf 2 story house and the router is in the utility room on the main floor. I usually am across the house and one floor up when I use it and speed and range have been no issue. I was happy to get rid of the Wi-Fi extender I needed before, and the speed is where I expected it to be based on my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: MarkF

customer_reviews.title: Pay before you get a new one!!  Not so good. :(
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this router under 6 months ago, still under warranty, and it failed. In order for me to get a new one within 3-5 days, I have to pay $15, otherwise it would have taken up to 10 days. TP LINK wanted me to send the one I purchased back FIRST and then they would mail me the new one. Their product failure - yet I have to pay to get a new one shipped. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Russ

customer_reviews.title: Faster and better!!
customer_reviews.text: We had a router we were using from Spectrum and paying 5 bucks a month for it. It never worked on the other side of the house (2400 sq. feet). My kids could not get reception in their rooms. Now no problem and works very fast! We keep it on top of my secretary and it blends in pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Spay & Neuter

customer_reviews.title: Very good router for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100Mbps plan with dual band. The internet was just coming and going with my old router, which I am glad I replace with this AC2300 router. Honestly I could notice the difference right away. The picture quality of TV broadcast greatly improved and now enjoying true HD videos from my ROKU Stick, Sling TV, Prime video. I am able to connect multiple devices to same wifi network without any issue of poor signals or signal dropping in my whole house. This router is delivering incredible speed both upload and download. I would highly recommend this router to any homeowner who wants superior wi-fi in their home.
customer_reviews.author: Hatim

customer_reviews.title: Router stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I had an Apple Airport for 4 years and never had issues. Decided to get this TP-Link unit since we needed one with extended range. When it worked, it was good. Received strong signal upstairs and fast data speeds. After a 1.5 month, the unit just stopped working. Followed the Tether app instructions to reset (multiple times) and router was still inoperable. The issue the router experienced was all the required lights were on (i.e. internet, wi-fi, power, etc..), but the router's SSID did not register on any of our devices. Even after reset, the default TP-Link SSID went missing.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H

customer_reviews.title: Dont Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this only because it was expensive yet it has difficulty with the essentials. I had to connect my old router with this router because my cell phone for some odd reason disconnects wt the TP-Link. Everything else works great as long as its hard wired or on the 5G. I just regret buying because it was so expensive yet cannot connect my cell phone. Next I will stick wt a Netgear for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel A. Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to set up, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. The USB ports allow me to connect two external drives (one HD on the USB2.0 port and one SSD on the USB3.0 port) for remote file sharing. I also have an industrial device set up for NAT Forwarding, this technique would also work for a web cam. Everything was very easy to set up without any glitches or surprises.
customer_reviews.author: Customer256

customer_reviews.title: Died on me after a restart
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 or 3 weeks then the wifi part of it gave out on me after I accidentally turned the power strip off and back on again. I'm waiting for a return request and would love to try again with a different model. I loved the router before, we had it in the upstairs of our 2 story house and it covered the first two floors well and an repeater in the basement helped finish the coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Appelgate

customer_reviews.title: Print server software feature does not work with Windows 10 2019
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything under the sun to connect to the printer attached to the router USB port. The software provided does not support the network printing protocols in Win10 2019 update. Other than that it worked very well. 3 star only for not providing updated software for print server. If you don't need that feature, it could be a good wifi router. I did not attempt to contact tech support as I was able to get my old wifi router to work with a firmware downgrade. Returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: attacks and very poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up if you dont use any features. I keep getting attacked ever since i bought it. These are chacha type attacks to weak spots in cryptology supposedly. I ask customer service and they never heard of it. One laptop was attacked 20 times overnight. Its not getting in as attack was shown on trend mico antivirus window,which one tech support didnt even know they had. It doesnt mean the attacks wont get in at some point, btw trend micro didnt even have someone to talk to. I would not buy it if i had to do over.
customer_reviews.author: vern

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup...go to weblink and fill in setting and your good. Signal covers 2500 sqft house and it is set in the corner and every high speed. full wire bars
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: fast and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It's 5G. Didn't think it said that in the instructions, but when I turned it on there it was. We can finally watch HD movies on our in home devices and still have the "youngenz" happy on the planet of zorg or wherever the heck that game is located. Changed 10 devices over in about 10 minutes and set it up in about 5. The only downside is the a power cord was 6 inches too short from where I wanted to put it.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Save your money....
customer_reviews.text: I have the same failure problems the other reviewers are noting. I purchased less than 9 months ago and now everythign is dead. Router won't even reset. Most reviewers are noting months and still no contact from custojer service so I'm not even going to attempt. why? Becasue like most reading this...I NEED wifi in the house now...not next year. Purchase NETGEAR...better porduct that I have never had a n issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I went to Fiber internet because my old router just couldn't handle it. Switching to this router doubled my throughput on the same connection. I'm a happy camper, highly recommend this router, great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage, solid performance
customer_reviews.text: Installed it in a challenging space for any wifi router -- large coverage area to support, lots of competing wifi signals on the floors above and below and other areas on the same floor. It automatically adjusts to the best set of channels. We get great coverage for both 2.4 and 5GHz. Additionally, we are running our phone system over the same network. We average about 20 concurrent devices of various types. The router performs flawlessly with no degradation. And it is stable. It has never gone down or dropped provider connection since I installed it, over a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Ok at first but not after a year
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this device for one year and two months. It started off ok, but performance has degraded severely. I am constantly having to reset the router. Nothing is wrong with my internet service, the problem is with this router. For this price point, I was hoping for a router that would last a number of years.
customer_reviews.author: H. Slansky

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent
customer_reviews.text: Works good but the 5 channel is kinda unstable it disconnects randomly. It does have great range
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, broken in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: This router worked fine when we first got it, and was easy to set up. It slowly started dying and within a year or so barely worked. This is a low end commodity router, and I suspect they use really cheap components that just can't hold up to normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: tagger9

customer_reviews.title: Terrible terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: unit stopped working. 2 hour with tech support then had to pay to get the replacement shipped. Replacement is not new and doesn't work. So far I've spent another hour on the phone and waiting for a manager to call me back. NEVER EVER will I buy tp-link products again. I will end up throwing this in the trash and eat the $100 and but something else.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: What The Doctor Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Have no idea about gaming suitability or tech support as I haven’t needed either. ‘Have even less of an idea why Amazon is asking about touchscreen. This is a ROUTER! Anyway, the router has provided the improved bps throughput, esp. for video streaming, I was looking for, and there’ve been no problems with it. I would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: aprimeclient

customer_reviews.title: Boosted my speed when compared to the one Comcast makes you rent
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4ghz connection sits about 30ish mbps and the 5ghz connection sits about 200mbps. Still not what I am paying for but it is a lot closer, and the 5ghz line is drastically better than the modem/router Comcast gives you to rent. I am not knowledgeable enough with customizing my router, but TP-Link's settings page is beginner friendly and easy to use. Have not had any issues with it going down or resetting, and have not had to deal with their customer support.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I was getting slow Wi-Fi with my hand me down router and was in a fire need for a new router. I bought the AC2300 TP-Link and couldn't be more pleased. I've had this router for about a week. I currently have 400mb internet service and this router brought me very close, if not the exact speed I'm paying for. I'm glad I put on the money to receive the quality I did.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Zehren

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and functionalities
customer_reviews.text: It is a great router, it works perfectly and provides fast connectivity for mobile devices and those that perform TV streaming. The antivirus functionality is great, it informed me of unusual activities on some devices and so I could take corrective actions. It blocks the external attacks that they present every day and the reports are good. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Firmware update killed it.
customer_reviews.text: It was working great until the firmware update. Now the 5G doesn't work and while it says the 2.4G is working, none of my devices can see it. Factory default reset didn't help. I got nearly two and a half years out of it which is more than a lot of folks on here but still not happy with TP-Link. Definitely not buying any more of their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: ... high expectations for this router because it got such great reviews but I must have gotten a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for this router because it got such great reviews but I must have gotten a lemon. It worked fine right after I unpacked it but, as soon as I tried to change a setting to create a guest account, the 5 Ghz signal stopped working. I tried to factory reset the router but nothing happened. I switched out cables but nothing happened. I reset the password but nothing happened. This was all only a few hours after I took the item out of the box. Only one day later the router stopped working entirely. My modem would not recognize that the router even existed. I returned this router and bought a Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great signal and speed
customer_reviews.text: Im in a high density neighborhood and my house gets the wifi signals from all my neighbors. The 2300 replaced a pretty new high end router and delivers a MUCH stronger signal. If you’re in a crowded area, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: hurbert

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time or $$$
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was great. Only worked for 3 days. Customer service the worst I have ever experienced. User interface looked like it could be handy but was super slow and o my updated 1/2 of the info
customer_reviews.author: Becks

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi connections
customer_reviews.text: Drops wifi connections about once a day. Some combination of rebooting router and devices (iphone, Android, and other) is required to get the connection back. I replaced it with a Google wifi unit and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Atwell

customer_reviews.title: Good router and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I had a recent lightning storm that somehow fried the Ethernet ports on my modem, router, and motherboard. Everything still worked somehow but the Ethernet ports were fried. Picked this up as a replacement and so far it works great. Took less than 10 minutes to setup and get configured.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D.

customer_reviews.title: Never Able to Get 5G Speeds on This Router!
customer_reviews.text: I was never able to get 5G speeds on this router even though it has both the 2.4mghz and a 5mghz networks. Just could not ever connect to the 5 mghz even on factory reset with the ID and password on the damn router. After spending 8 hours with customer support over 2 days they told me I needed a new router. It's 6 months out of warranty (2 years only) and they could not do anything to help me. So, if you want a new router 2.5 years later, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but inconsistent speeds
customer_reviews.text: Its an average router. Does the trick if you want to do average stuff in your house. Im giving it two stars because you can use an app to set everything up. Otherwise I wasn't really getting consistent speeds on my gigabit connection, whereas my old router was getting faster speeds. I did put 12 devices on it
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim yusuf

customer_reviews.title: It’s Fast
customer_reviews.text: The product is wonderful. It is so fast. Set up was a breeze. It’s attractive and has a low profile. Be wary of Amazon delivery. This is the second time the driver has thrown my electronics up my front stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy E

customer_reviews.title: would leave 4.99 stars, but...
customer_reviews.text: my ONLY issue is the antennae don't stay put. they are connected, but they must be completely vertical, or they fall onto the desk. pics show them pointed to all angles. VERY EASY setup, FANTASTIC features, and GREAT coverage. love it
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Better range
customer_reviews.text: This has better range than a D Link AC1200 (which I just returned) or a WRT54GL (router I am replacing). Used Android's WiFi Analyzer to confirm signal strength. Able to stream Netflix without drops on 5Ghtz channel while feeding other devices on 2Ghtz band. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Milazzo

customer_reviews.title: Good router for the price
customer_reviews.text: One of the most powerful routers of its price range. Also has antivirus software baked in.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Good parental controls and extra protection
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade over my previous router. Parental controls are great. I like the ability to filter certain content and set shut-off times. Built-in malware protection is a nice feature too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works good but doesn’t last more than a year
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good router when it’s working. Problem is I bought one in 2017. Bought a replacement in 2018. Now it just turned 2020 and I need another replacement. They are under warranty but they want you to pack up the non working router and mail it to them. Upon receipt they will send a replacement. Meanwhile you have no internet and the process takes weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Conner

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi range!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older TP-Link model with this wireless router. We used to have 4 extenders through the house in order to get signal. With this purchase we have 4-5 bars throughout the house, out to the street, and in our neighbor's yard!
customer_reviews.author: D Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly. I have never had to reboot the device and the signal is consistently strong. Works well for streaming to and from my Plex server, multiple PCs, cell phones, and smart TV's. Also my brother no longer complains of lag on his PS4 across the house. All in all this is the best router I have ever owned, plus the price is much better than the other competitors in it tier.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Lote

customer_reviews.title: Trusted Brand
customer_reviews.text: I returned this router because it seemed to be faulty. TP-Link makes great products because I have a router and power line kit from them. TP-Link is extremely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Use; but Poor Range
customer_reviews.text: The signal fails through 3 walls and a distance of about 20 feet, all on the same floor. The next thing I'll try is relocating the device centrally so only 2 walls are between the rooms in question. I may revise my rating if all works well.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Wills

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this for close to month. It ...
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: customer support promptly RMA'd the device when I emailed them, although their over the phone support is not great. So far it has been working no problems. Missing one star for the original faulty product. I've been using this for close to month. It reboots at least 10 times a day. Probably more. I've factory reset and updated firmware, changed various settings. If I kept the box I would return it but I cant keep the box of everything I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Have Great Speeds in every room in my house and also outside. Amazing how Fast the 5ghz band is....and all over. My internet is 300Mbs and with 5ghz I get over 270Mbs in the same room; and the slowest is 140Mbs outside my house. Truly amazing wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: The Digital Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fails to connect (or impress).
customer_reviews.text: Ever since setting up the router there have been problems. Would constantly have to reboot the thing in order to get my PC or Chromecast to connect to the network. Then finally about 1 1/2 months in, after a reboot, the thing wouldn't power on anymore! Luckily the Amazon return process is pretty on point so i will be replacing this for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It,,...
customer_reviews.text: Best router I have ever owned. Outstanding range and speed. This router is much better than more expensive models and has understated looks
customer_reviews.author: Brooke T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Set it up in 10 minutes. I was so surprised how easy it was. Should have done this years ago. It also works great.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Cost benefit balance
customer_reviews.text: It worked as expected. The WiFi range increased dramatically and my entire network devices are faster than before use the router. Easy to setup with interesting options. I found a good balance between price and features. It has MU-MIMO that is great. I live in a zone with a severe WiFi congestion and now I can connect without interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Bercelino J. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Another TP-Link Router That's Great When New But Dies Quickly - No Warranty Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Great specs, performance, design, price, but died quickly - just like my TP-Link Archer C7 did!!!. After 3 days, my brand spanking new TP-Link Archer C2300 died. Thanks for the prompt refund, Amazon. Time for a different brand. Can you spell NETGEAR?
customer_reviews.author: Trusting Customer

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC2300 Wifi Router
product_meta.description:
The Archer C2300 sends more bandwidth and creates faster connections for 4K streaming and gaming. Wave 2 AC2300 Wi-Fi delivers up to 2225Mbps over dual 2.4 GHz (600 Mbps) and 5 GHz (1625 Mbps) bands. Wave 2 AC2300 provides up to 204% more throughput than AC750 routers, letting you game at the highest settings while streaming content on multiple devices without slowing down your Wi-Fi. With stream processor architecture, The Archer C2300 dedicates one processor to each of its Wi-Fi bands. These processors handle Wi-Fi traffic, freeing the router's powerful 1.8 GHz dual-core 64-bit CPU to take care of everything else. All this extra brainpower keeps your Wi-Fi running smoothly so everyone in your home can enjoy what they love most, whether that's watching Netflix, gaming online, streaming music—or all of the Above.

*free 3-year subscription of TP-Link home care powered by Trend Micro included. Deactivation will disable certain security features. The TP-Link home care feature requires a firmware update to enable. Environment Operating Temperature: 0 Degrees Celsius ~40 Degrees Celsius , Storage Temperature: -40 Degrees Celsius ~70 Degrees Celsius , Operating Humidity: 10%~90% non-condensing and Storage Humidity: 5%~90% non-condensing.
feature_bullets: Industry leading 2 year warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support
Powerful 1.8GHz dual core processor leading edge 1.8GHz dual core 64 bit CPU with 2 co processors and stream processing architecture for smoother performance and powerful multi tasking

Faster Wi Fi enjoy 4K video and play online games simultaneously with ultra fast 802.11AC Wave 2 MU MIMO Wi Fi. System Requirements Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, MAC OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux, Internet Explorer 11, Firefox 12.0, Chrome 20.0, Safari 4.0, or other Java enabled browser, Cable or DSL Modem, Subscription with an Internet Service Provider (for Internet access)
Vonn Server set up a personal VPN Server with an open client to browse the web and access files without paid VPN subscriptions

Far reaching Wi Fi range Boost amplifies the router's ability to detect and receive Wi Fi signal from devices located farther away. Beamforming locates Wi Fi devices and focuses the router's wireless signal toward them
Efficient Wi Fi distribution airtime Fairness equally divides attention between newer and older devices to improve Wi Fi performance and reliability without limiting your network
Link Aggregation team up two of the four Gigabit LAN ports to double connection speeds from 1 Gaps to 2 Gaps
Enjoy AP mode switch the router to AP mode and enjoy faster Wi Fi without replacing your router or sip required Gateway

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars890 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
